flawed_nl_solution:
A leap year is one day shorter than a regular year, so it is 365 - 1 = <<365-1=364>>364 days.
Brittany washes her hair every other day, so she will wash it 364 / 2 = <<364/2=182>>182 times in a leap year.
A bottle of shampoo lasts her 14 / 1 / 4 = 14 * 4 = 3.5 washes.
If she buys 3 bottles, she will only have enough for 3.5 * 3 = <<3*3.5=12.56>>12.56 washes.
If she buys 4 bottles, she will have enough for 3.5 * 4 = <<4*3.5=14>>14 washes.
Since 12.56 < 182 and 14 > 182, Brittany needs 4 bottles of shampoo to get her through a leap year.
#### 4

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 10.5, not 12.5588090351. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
